[ Package Index | Mudlib Index | Effect Index ]

File /std/room/basic/door.c

Inherits

This class inherits the following classes /std/basic/id_match.c, /std/basic/enchant.c, /std/basic/close_lock.c, /std/basic/property.c, /std/basic/trap.c and /std/basic/hide_invis.c

Includes

This class includes the following files /include/parse_command.h, /include/dirs.h, /include/room.h and /include/door.h

query_determinate
string query_determinate()
query_door_name
string query_door_name()
This returns the name of the door. Note that this is different to the actual 'name' of the door. It is normally an exciting and original value of 'door'.

Returns:
a string representing the door name.
query_how_many
int query_how_many()
This method returns how many doors are stored in this particular door object. This is used for double doors and things like that to make the plurals work correctly.

Returns:
an integer value representing the number of doors.
See also:
set_how_many()
query_lock_owner
mixed query_lock_owner()
This method is used to determine which player owns the lock on this door.

Returns:
a string containing the name of the player who owns the lock.
See also:
set_lock_owner()
query_long
string query_long()
query_my_id
string query_my_id()
query_my_room
object query_my_room()
query_name
string * query_name()
query_one_way
int query_one_way()
This method is used to determine if a door has been flagged as being 'one way' or not.

Returns:
an integer value which returns 1 if the door is one way, 0 if it is not.
See also:
set_one_way()
query_other_id
string query_other_id()
query_parse_id
object query_parse_id(mixed * arr)
query_plu
string * query_plu()
query_plural
string query_plural()
query_short
string query_short()
This method returns the short of the door. This is normally a string like "east door".

Returns:
a string containing the short for the door.
See also:
set_short()
set_dest
void set_dest(string word)
set_door_name
void set_door_name(string word)
This method sets the name of the door. Note that this is different to the actual visible name or short of the door.

Parameters:
word - the new door name
See also:
query_door_name() and set_short()
set_how_many
void set_how_many(int number)
This method sets how many doors there are so that plurals and everything are set correctly. It also flags the door with the "group object" property.

Parameters:
number - the number of doors this door should represent.
See also:
query_how_many()
set_lock_owner
void set_lock_owner(string owner)
This method sets the owner of the lock. This value is used in pick_lock() to determine whether or not various PK checks etc are passed.

Parameters:
owner - the name of the player who owns the lock.
set_long
void set_long(string word)
set_my_id
void set_my_id(string word)
set_one_way
void set_one_way(int number)
This method is used to set whether or not the door is one way. A one way door won't trigger a "broken door" message when there's no exit leading back.

Parameters:
number - pass 1 if the door is one way, or 0 if it isn't.
set_other_id
void set_other_id(string word)
set_short
void set_short(string words)
This method sets the short for the door. As well as setting the short, it calculates the name, adjectives and plurals for the door.

Parameters:
words - the short to set for the door object.
See also:
query_short()
setup_door
void setup_door(string word,
object mine,
string his,
mixed * args,
string type)
This method is called by /std/room/basic_room.c in query_door() to create the door.

Parameters:
word - the name of the door being created
mine - the object that owns the door
his - the destination for the door
args - dest_other information from door. This is mainly the modify_exit() parameters.
type - the type of the door, eg, door, window, etc.
short
string short()
tell_door
void tell_door(string words,
object thing)
the_short
string the_short()
